patterns: How do I set up call forwarding on my phone?
responses: To set up call forwarding, open your phone's dialer and enter the appropriate forwarding code followed by the destination number. For example, to forward all calls, dial '*72' followed by the number you want calls to be forwarded to. To disable call forwarding, dial '*73'

On most smartphones, you can go to the settings menu, select 'Network & Internet,' and then choose 'Hotspot & Tethering.'From there, you can enable the hotspot and set a password. This will allow you to share your mobile data with other devices like laptops and tablets.

patterns: What is the permissible minimum Broadband speed limit?
responses: As per the regulation on “Quality of Service standards for Broadband Services” issued by TRAI on 6th October, 2006, a subscriber should get minimum 80% of the subscribed broadband connection speed from ISP Node to user.

patterns: What is the minimum download speed prescribed for broadband service provider?
responses: As per quality of service of broadband service (Second Amendment) regulations, 2014 a minimum download speed of 512 kbps will be provided to an individual subscribers by the service provider.

patterns: How can I set up a conference call?

patterns: Can I change my phone plan in the middle of a billing cycle?

patterns: What is the fair speed usage limit in case of unlimited data plan?
responses: This is the limit of data consumption upto which the subscriber get the promised speed. After the limit get exhausted, the speed is reduced. TRAI has mandated the Telecom Service Provider clearly specifying their fair usage limit and the data speed to be provided after the fair usage limit gets exhausted.

patterns: What is a legacy system in telecom?
responses: A telecom system is a network of communications facilities and equipment that are used to transmit voice, data, and video traffic. A legacy telecom system is an older system that has been in use for many years. These systems are often complex and expensive to maintain. However, they can be very reliable and offer a wide range of features. Legacy telecom systems are often replaced by newer, more modern systems. However, in some cases, these older systems may still be the best option for a particular application so an API (software intermediary) may be implemented to maintain a working connection.
